stork.feather

Class URI

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.URI

  • public class URI
extends Object
    A representation of a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). The getter methods of this class which return single components will return unescaped (decoded) representations, and likewise the single-component setter methods expect unescaped inputs; the getter methods which return concatenated component groups will return representations with escaped (encoded) subcomponents and unescaped joiners, and likewise the component group setter methods expect escaped inputs with unescaped joiners.

    The syntax of URIs in Feather conform to the URI generic syntax defined in RFC 3986. However, some non-standard component groups are also defined for URLs, as shown in this diagram: 

                           authority
                  _________|__________
                 /                    \
                 userinfo      hostport
             _______|_______   ___|___
            /               \ /       \
   scheme://username:password@host:port/path?query#fragment
   \__________________________________/\__________________/
                     |                          |
                  endpoint                   resource
    The API is inspired heavily by URI.js, which can be found here:
    https://github.com/medialize/URI.js

      • userPass

        public String[] userPass()
        Return the user-info segment split and decoded into a separated username and password. If there is no user-info segment, the returned array contains two nulls.
        Returns:
        An array of two strings containing the split and decoded user-info segment, or null if any of the components were not specified.

      • userPass

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A URI based on this one with the given user-info component.

      • userInfo

        public String userInfo()
        Get the user-info segment in the form "[user][:pass]", if this is a URL. If the password is not included in the URI, this is equivalent to username(). If the username is not included in the URI, this returns the result of password() preceded with a colon.
        Returns:
        The user-info segment of the URI.

      • hostPort

        public String hostPort()
        Get the host and port in the form host[:port]. The returned string will also be properly bracketed according to RFC 2732 for hosts containing colons (e.g., IPv6 addresses).
        Returns:
        The concatenated host and port according to the authority segment of the URI, or just the host if no port is specified. If neither are specified, null is returned.

      • hostPort

        public URI hostPort(String hostport)
        Return a URI based on this one with the given host and port components.
        Parameters:
        hostport - the new host, escaped and bracketed, concatenated with the port with a colon separator.
        Returns:
        A URI based on this one with the given host and port components.

      • resource

        public String resource()
        Get the resource component of the URI, if it is a URL. The returned string is in the form of:
        [path][?query][#fragment]
        This method will return null if the URI does not have a resource component.

      • resource

      • endpoint

        public String endpoint()
        Get the endpoint component of the URI, if it is a URL. The returned string is in the form of:
        [scheme:][//authority]
        This method will return null if the URI does not have an endpoint component.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Check if this is an empty URI. That is, if all of its components are null, or a URI whose string representation is an empty string.
        Returns:
        true if the URI is empty; false otherwise.

      • isAbsolute

        public final boolean isAbsolute()
        Return whether or not the URI is absolute. That is, whether or not the URI contains a scheme name.
        Returns:
        true if this URI is absolute; false otherwise.

      • relativeTo

        public URI relativeTo(URI base)
        Return a URI based on this one relativized to base. If there is no overlap between this URI and base, this URI is returned. TODO
        Parameters:
        base - the base URI to relativize this URI to.
        Returns:
        A URI based on this one, relative to base,

      • hierarchicalPart

        public String hierarchicalPart()
        Get the hierarchical component of the URI. The returned string is in the form of:
        [[authority]path]
        This method will return null if the URI does not have a hierarchical component.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Return a properly escaped string representation of this URI. This string is generated based on the components of the URI. It should be possible to create an identical URI by passing the returned string to create(String).
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object object)
        Test this URI for equivalence to another object. A URI is equivalent to another URI if they are component-wise equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        object - the object to test equivalence with.
        Returns:
        true if this URI is equivalent to object; false otherwise.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Generate a hash code for this URI. A URI's hash code should be the same as the hash code of its string representation.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        A hash code for this URI.
